snippet: Brandon Morrow struck out 10.188 hitters per nine innings last season — a better rate than that of Justin Verlander, C. C. Sabathia, Felix Hernandez and every other starter in the league.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column maintains that Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Brandon Morrow is underrated, with a strike out average of 10.188 hitters per nine innings last season, the best rate among starters in the American League.
lead_paragraph: Brandon Morrow struck out 10.188 hitters per nine innings last season — a better rate than that of Justin Verlander, C. C. Sabathia, Felix Hernandez and every other starter in the league.

headline.seo: On Baseball — Blue Jays’ Morrow Is Trying to Channel the Ace Within
headline.main: Blue Jays’ Morrow Is Trying to Channel the Ace Within
